verses.text: 摩西回答：「看哪，他們必不信我，也不聽我的話；因為他們必說：『耶和華並沒有向你顯現。』」

words.note: Emphatic interjection, common in biblical text.
Used to intensify a negative statement before '沒有'.

verses.text: 耶和華問摩西：「那在你手裡的是甚麼？」他說：「是手杖。」
耶和華說：「把它丟在地上。」摩西把它一丟在地上，它就變了蛇；摩西就逃跑，離開了牠。

words.note: Used before a verb to indicate immediate action.

verses.text: 耶和華對摩西說：「伸出你的手來，捉住蛇的尾巴。」摩西就伸出手來，緊握著牠，牠在摩西的掌中又變回了手杖。

words.note: Indicates direction towards the speaker or a result.
Indicates direction towards the speaker or a result.

verses.text: 「這樣就使他們相信耶和華他們祖宗的 神，就是亞伯拉罕的 神、以撒的 神、雅各的 神曾向你顯現了。」

words.note: Used as a proper noun for the singular God.
Used as a proper noun for the singular God.
Used as a proper noun for the singular God.
Used as a proper noun for the singular God.

verses.text: 耶和華又再對摩西說：「現在把你的手放進懷裡。」摩西就把手放進懷裡；等他把手抽出來的時候，手就長滿了痲風，像雪那樣白。

words.note: Often combined with 又 (yòu) to emphasize 'again'.
Used to pre-pose the direct object, indicating disposal or action upon it.
Here, '的時候' indicates 'when...'
Refers to Hansen's disease, frequently mentioned in the Bible.

verses.text: 耶和華說：「把你的手再放進懷裡。」摩西就把手再放進懷裡；等他把手從懷裡抽出來的時候，手就恢復過來，像身上別處的肉一樣。

words.note: Here, '的時候' indicates 'when...'
過來 (guòlái) here indicates return to a normal state.

verses.text: 耶和華又說：「如果他們不信你，也不聽從頭一個神蹟的話，他們必信隨後來的神蹟。

words.note: Used with '如果...的話' to form an 'if...then' clause.

verses.text: 如果連這兩個神蹟他們也不信，也不聽你的話，你就從河裡取些水，倒在旱地上；你從河裡取來的水就必在旱地上變成血。」

words.note: Indicates an unexpected or extreme case.

verses.text: 摩西對耶和華說：「主啊，我不是個會說話的人；以前不是，自從你對僕人說話以後也不是；因為我本是拙口笨舌的。」

words.note: A respectful address to God or a superior.
Often short for 一個 (yīgè), 'one unit of'.
An idiom describing someone who is not eloquent or articulate.

verses.text: 耶和華對他說：「誰造人的口呢？誰使人口啞、耳聾、眼明、眼瞎呢？不是我耶和華嗎？

words.note: Transliteration of God's personal name in the Old Testament.
Often used in a religious context for miraculous sight or understanding.

verses.text: 現在去吧，我必賜你口才，指教你當說的。」

words.note: Often used for gifts or blessings from a superior, especially divine.

verses.text: 摩西說：「主啊，請你差派你願意差派的人。」

words.note: In a religious context, refers to God or Jesus.
Often used for divine commissioning or sending forth.

verses.text: 耶和華向摩西發怒，說：「不是有你的哥哥利未人亞倫嗎？我知道他是有口才的；他現在出來要迎接你。他看見了你，心裡就快樂。

words.note: A descendant of Levi, serving in the temple.

verses.text: 你要對他說話，把你要說的話放在他的口裡；我必與你的口同在，也與他的口同在；我必指教你們當行的事。

words.note: Often refers to God's presence or companionship.

verses.text: 他要替你向人民說話，他要作你的口，你要作他的 神。

words.note: The preceding space indicates a divine proper noun in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 這手杖你要拿在手裡，用來行神蹟。」

words.definition: used for, for the purpose of

words.note: Literally 'divine sign'.

verses.text: 於是，摩西起程回到他岳父葉忒羅那裡，對他說：「請你容我離開這裡，回到我在埃及的同胞那裡，看看他們是否還在。」葉忒羅對摩西說：「你可以平平安安地去吧。」

words.note: Literally 'from the same womb', implying shared origin/nationality.
Reduplication for a softer, more casual tone.
AABB reduplication for emphasis, meaning 'very safely and peacefully'.
Connects an adjective to a verb to form an adverbial phrase.

verses.heading: The Return of Moses

verses.text: 耶和華在米甸對摩西說：「你要起程，回到埃及去，因為那些尋索你命的人都死了。」

words.note: Often implies seeking with hostile intent.
Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 摩西就帶著他的妻子和孩子，讓他們騎在驢上，向著埃及地回去了；摩西手裡拿著 神的杖。

words.note: Indicates an action in progress or a state.
Indicates an action in progress or a state.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Indicates an action in progress or a state.
The preceding space indicates a divine proper noun in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 耶和華對摩西說：「你起程回到埃及去的時候，要留意我交在你手裡的一切奇事，把它們行在法老面前；我卻要使他的心剛硬，他就不讓人民離開。

words.note: Refers to supernatural events.
Often used in scripture to describe a stubborn heart.

verses.text: 你要對法老說：『耶和華這樣說：以色列是我的長子。

words.note: Refers to a literal firstborn or a specially favored child.

verses.text: 我曾對你說，要讓我的兒子離開這裡，好叫他事奉我。你還是拒絕讓他離開，看哪！我必殺你的長子。』」

words.note: Specifically refers to serving a deity or superior.
An exclamation to draw attention, common in biblical texts.
Refers to a literal firstborn or a specially favored child.

verses.text: 在路上住宿的地方，耶和華遇見了摩西，就想要殺他。
西坡拉就拿了一把石刀，把她兒子的包皮割下來，把它丟到摩西的腳上，說：「你真是我的血郎了！」

words.note: Ancient tool, contextually specific.
Specifically refers to anatomical foreskin.
A specific biblical term tied to the covenant of circumcision.

verses.text: 這樣，耶和華才放了他。那時西坡拉說：「你是血郎，是因為割禮的緣故。」

words.note: A unique biblical term related to the circumcision covenant.

verses.text: 耶和華對亞倫說：「你到曠野去迎接摩西。」他就去了；他在 神的山遇見了摩西，就和他親吻。
摩西把耶和華派他所說的一切話，和吩咐他所行的一切神蹟都告訴了亞倫。

words.note: Introduces direct object before verb.
Forms a nominal phrase: 'what was said by him'.
Forms a nominal phrase: 'what was done by him'.
Lit. 'divine trace' or 'divine sign'.

verses.text: 摩西和亞倫就去召集以色列人的長老。
亞倫把耶和華對摩西所說的一切話都說了一遍，並且在人民的眼前行了這些神蹟。

words.note: Introduces direct object before verb.
Forms a nominal phrase: 'what was said by him'.
Lit. 'divine trace' or 'divine sign'.

verses.text: 人民就相信了；他們聽見耶和華眷顧以色列人，也鑒察了他們的痛苦，就俯伏敬拜。

words.note: Indicates consequence or immediacy.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Resultative compound, meaning 'to hear and perceive'.
Transliteration of the Hebrew divine name.
Often used in religious contexts for divine care.
Implies careful and discerning observation, often by a higher authority.
Indicates completion or realization of an action.
Indicates consequence or result.
A posture of reverence or humility.
